intro: Palicourea corniculata, commonly known as the horned palicourea, is a climbing shrub native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many flowering plants known for their ornamental and medicinal value. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with prominent veins and small, white flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a small, fleshy capsule that splits open to release seeds. Palicourea corniculata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and undergrowth.
